intro: Peucedanum gallicum f. comosum, commonly known as the curly cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, often as a garden ornamental. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other members of the genus Peucedanum.
